media:group.media:title: County Manager Spotlight: PB&J Services
media:group.media:description: Bernalillo County Manager Julie Morgas Baca reads the children's book "Mother Bruce" to a dozen children at PB&J Services in the South Valley. Located in Albuquerque, N.M., PB&J Family Services is a nationally accredited agency offering therapeutic counseling, support, parenting education, early intervention and prevention and case management services to at-risk children within their families.

media:group.media:title: Forgotten Heroes Valley High School 2019
media:group.media:description: Recently, students from the Valley High School Woods and Metals class were honored for building wooden urns for 22 unclaimed veterans who were interred at the Santa Fe National Cemetery on Sept. 26 as part of the Forgotten Heroes program.

entry.title: Behavioral Health Initiative: Suicide Prevention Grants will focus on Youth

media:group.media:title: Behavioral Health Initiative: Suicide Prevention Grants will focus on Youth
media:group.media:description: The community within Bernalillo County has joined efforts to address suicide with an eight hundred thousand dollar grant to three agencies to focus on suicide prevention among 18-35 year olds. The awardees of the suicide prevention contract are: First Nations Community HealthSource, Albuquerque Public Schools, and Centro Savila. Suicide costs New Mexico a total of $506 million combined lifetime medical and work-loss costs in 2010 â€“ which averages to $1.2 million per suicide death.

entry.title: Behavioral Health Summit: Behavioral Health Care and the Workplace

media:group.media:title: Behavioral Health Summit: Behavioral Health Care and the Workplace
media:group.media:description: Commissioner Maggie Hart Stebbins host the event at Keshet Studios on Cutler NE. Mayling Armijo hosts and five panelists discuss working with and in the Behavioral Health programs and systems setup to help those in need of services. Panelists include Juliet Kinkade-Black, All Faiths Counseling Center - Ian Dunbar from the Sheriff's Dept. Academy, Enrique Cardiel, Bernalillo County Health Council - Mary Perez, UNM Hospital - Dr. Bill Wagner, Centro Savila

media:group.media:title: Unclaimed Indigent Memorial Burial Ceremony 2019
media:group.media:description: On September 19, 2019, Bernalillo County laid to rest 80 unclaimed and indigent residents at a community memorial burial service. Bernalillo County administers the Unclaimed/Indigent Cremation Program for deceased persons who have passed away within the geographical boundaries of Bernalillo County. The county contracts with Daniels Family Funeral Services to cremate and store the cremains of unclaimed/indigent persons for two years and then the cremains are made available for burial through the program. It is the mission of the Bernalillo County General Services Division to provide a deserved, lawful, proper and dignified manner of disposition for those decedent residents who are indigent or go unclaimed upon death, and to handle every case accurately and lawfully with the utmost attention. Bernalillo County respects each individual in the community and treats all with maximum regard and dignity.

entry.title: Bernalillo County launches App to track Needles Collection

media:group.media:title: Bernalillo County launches App to track Needles Collection
media:group.media:description: The Behavioral Health Initiative, working with the Planning and Development Services Department created an App that will help track "Sharps" needles that have been either discarded or placed in drop boxes located around the City and the County. This is a collaborative effort that includes the County, the City of Albuquerque, local neighborhood groups including the Bernalillo County Health Council and the State of New Mexico.
